title: REVIEW  ---  Play:  News Quiz  ----  By Daniel Akst
text:
1. The Senate narrowly confirmed Vanita Gupta -- to what Biden administration post?

A. Deputy Commerce Secretary

B. Assistant Secretary of Defense

C. Associate Attorney General

D. Chief of the Council of Economic Advisers

---

2. Shares of UiPath Inc. rose 23% in their market debut. What does the company do?

A. Unemployment insurance administration

B. User interface consulting

C. Online dating for hikers

D. Robotic process automation

---

3. In European soccer, the breakaway Super League collapsed after six English teams pulled out. Where were the other six teams from?

A. Germany and Italy

B. Italy and Spain

C. Spain and France

D. France and Germany

---

4. Former vice president Walter Mondale died at 93. Where in Minnesota was he born?

A. St. Helena

B. Manhattan

C. Ceylon

D. Capri

---

5. Which state called out the National Guard to cope with surging illegal border crossings?

A. California

B. Arizona

C. Texas

D. Vermont

---

6. President Biden called for halving U.S. greenhouse emissions from 2005 levels -- by what target date?

A. 2030

B. 2040

C. 2050

D. 2100

---

7. Which country's ruler, Idriss Deby, died after he was wounded in clashes between rebels and government troops?

A. Cameroon

B. Chad

C. Niger

D. Nigeria

---

8. Gymnastics star Simone Biles is leaving Nike for a new apparel deal -- with whom?

A. Carhart

B. Adidas

C. Athleta

D. Lululemon

---

9. Naples and the rest of Italy are bickering over credit for the espresso tradition. Who made the Italian coffee pot a global design symbol?

A. Renato Bialetti

B. Gianni Agnelli

C. Camillo Olivetti

D. Marcello Mastroianni

---

ANSWERS

1. C

2. D

3. B

4. C

5. B

6. A

7. B

8. C

9. A
